meanings.definition: A method of classification in biology that groups organisms based on shared characteristics.
meanings.sent1: In cladism, scientists categorize animals by looking at what they have in common.
meanings.sent2: Cladism helps scientists organize different animals by their similar traits.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that he was a master of cladism after sorting the animals by their stripes and spots.
meanings.sent4: The concept of cladism is like putting animals into different boxes based on their features.
meanings.sent5: Studying cladism is like solving a puzzle to see how animals are related through their shared traits.

meanings.definition: The belief that all living organisms are descended from a common ancestor.
meanings.sent1: Cladism suggests that all creatures come from one original living being.
meanings.sent2: The idea of cladism proposes that every living thing shares a common forefather.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, Uncle Bob humorously claimed cladism proved we were all cousins.
meanings.sent4: Thinking about cladism is like imagining a giant family tree connecting all life forms.
meanings.sent5: The notion of cladism paints a picture of a vast family reunion where all species are related.
